Articles.Content:
I've just put them on Curseforge.

However, all new projects there require manual review by the staff, so currently it's not visible to the public. It may take a day or two. I'll mention when it's up.

EDIT: And there we go, it's up and already getting downloads

http://kerbal.curseforge.com/ksp-mods/220907-rla-stockalike-archive-mirror

EDIT 2: And it looks like Curse is linking whatever I uploaded last to the direct download button. That's not good, I need to re-upload the files in a different order then. Should also make the naming a bit more obvious and add a note in the description.

EDIT 3: Now I'm getting "website is offline" messages when trying to upload...

EDIT 4: Uploaded and waiting for approval.

Edited May 31, 2014 by Streetwind

Any news on the new version of RLA Electric Engines? I use them extensively, even if they are underpowered now after the stock ion engine was buffed up to 2.0 thrust. (nothing some text-file editing can't fix ^.^)
Woke up this morning and Curse download is working fine (finally).
Thanks so much!

Woke up this morning and Curse download is working fine (finally).

Streetwind, do you have the RLA ion engines pack? I have that pack (in fact, I have an entire downloads folder) if you need it.

Yes, it's all bundled into one download. The project description on Curse reflects this, as does the file description itself - though I suppose I could make it a little clearer. Will fix right now.

Originally I had uploaded all four files individually, but Curse has this thing where they link whatever you upload last to a big fat "download now" button. This not only led to users downloading the wrong file, but also by design prevents a lot of people from even looking into the files section and noticing multiple files. Therefore I decided to bundle it up into one. The alternative would have been to make four different Curse projects.

Edited June 1, 2014 by Streetwind
Anyone know what happened to the original mod author, he was developing a new version if I remember correctly?
All I know is, he hasn't posted anywhere on these forums for many months now.
Someone please do a remake of this mod on curse.

Someone please do a remake of this mod on curse.
streetwind uploaded it to curse what more could you want?
Does this work for 0.23.5?

considering its just a parts mod that doesn't rely on any plugins technically yes, but some of the part ballance may be a bit off(for example the electric engines pack doesn't reflect the buff squad made to its own ion engine, also the rcs thrusters don't reflect squads recent trend of making the smallest of parts effectively massless)
what happened to hoojiwana?

Anyone tested this on 0.24?

It worked on 0.23.5 without any changes? However, it may need price rebalancing now.

Anyone tested this on 0.24?

It worked on 0.23.5 without any changes? However, it may need price rebalancing now.

Should work, since its just parts. But yes, costs may be weird.
Since 0.24 is a career-mode-only update, there' not much point in playing it until someone releases a proper pricing mod.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/86665-Cost-Rebalance-for-KSPX-and-RLA

Here's a rebalance for RLA Stockalike and a temporary rebalance for KSPX.
RLA usability & pricing tweaks in handy module manager format, Dropbox link: tweaksRLA.cfg from my modset.
how do your prices compare to mine?

Tweaks were made for RLA Stockalike 0.9.4. Its a part of grater project - Changes in prices and characteristics to made parts form various mods competitive with stock parts. Those slightly better should be at least more expensive, weaker or smaller (to some degree) should be cheaper

I've added a note to the Curse repository linking to GregroxMun's update and clarifying that the Curse repository is not associated with it. This should help prevent confusion and funnel a couple more people towards the update.
From very brief testing in sandbox, RLA seems working with 1.2, although I am not sure about balancing, but not because of something found, but simple due to lack of knowledge on my side ;-)

This is the current thread below. I recently updated the mod to 1.2.

This thread should probably be locked to avoid confusion, like above.

Awesome! But considering 1.2.1 just for out... would it affect row somehow? Also from rumours only rebuilding and marking as 1.2.1 ready could be enough (?)

Anyway great job as this is my must have mod by all means.
